poem:
"Parable of the Jury"

Split jurors, truth obscured,
An acquittal seemingly assured.
Yet a miscarriage, in silent refrain,
Upon majority's whim sustains.
Wrongfully stained, justice strained;
Oh, to balance the scales regained.
Return, unanimity, unmask doubt,
To its rightful mantle, please tout.
Innocence lost, in the courtroom's fray,
A single voice might lead the way.
